For explanations of generalized dynamical systems as well as how the mathematical specification library works in detail, please consult the documentation here

Graph Legend:
Cylinder: Entity
Orange Diamond: Boundary Action
Red Square: Policy
Blue Circle: Mechanism
Transparent Circle: State Variable

Action Map

State

Local States

Servicer State

Name Description Type Symbol Domain
Public keyThe identifier of the nodePublic Key
Servicer SalaryA ServicerSalary is assigned to each individual Servicer based on their specific ReportCard, and is distributed every SalaryBlockFrequencyuPOKT
Report CardThe report card used when determing salary for a servicer. A ReportCard can be viewed as a rolling average of the Servicer's performance, where TestScores are removed when either TestScoreExpiration is passed or the TestScore FIFO queue exceeds MaxTestScores.Service Report Card
Test ScoresThe QoS test scoresService Test Scores
POKT HoldingsThe personal holdings of the servicer in uPOKTuPOKT
Staked POKTThe amount that is staked by the servicer currently in uPOKTuPOKT
Service URLThe API endpoint where the Web3 service is providedService URL
ServicesThe flavor(s) of Web3 hosted by this ServicerList[Service]
GeoZoneThe physical geo-location identifier this Servicer registered in. There is no formal requirement or validation (e.g. IP verification) for an actor to be physically located in the GeoZone it registers in. However, crypto-economic incentives drive actors to be registered close to where they are physically located to receive and provide the best service possible. The number of GeoZones an actor can stake for is limited to one to incentivize real geographic distribution.GeoZone
Operator Public KeyOPTIONAL; The non-custodial pubKey operating this nodePublic Key
Pause HeightThe height for which a servicer has been paused atBlock Height
Stake StatusThe status of staking for the actorStakeStatusType
Unstaking HeightThe height for which a servicer has begun unstaking at or none to represent no unstakingBlock Height

Name Description Type Symbol Domain

POKT HoldingsThe personal holdings of the application in uPOKTuPOKT
Staked POKTThe staked amount of the application in uPOKTuPOKT
ServicesThe flavor(s) of Web3 hosted by this ServicerList[Service]
GeoZoneThe physical geo-location identifier this Servicer registered inGeoZone
Number of ServicersThe number of servicers an application would prefer, if available, for a session.int
Stake StatusThe status of staking for the actorStakeStatusType
Unstaking HeightThe height for which a servicer has begun unstaking at or none to represent no unstakingBlock Height
DelegateThe portal which has been delegated to or None if there is no delegatePortal Entity

Portal State

Name Description Type Symbol Domain
Stake StatusThe status of staking for the actorStakeStatusType
DelegatorsThe applications which have delegated to this portalList[Application Entity]
POKT HoldingsThe personal holdings of the application in uPOKTuPOKT
Staked POKTThe amount that is staked by the application currently in uPOKTuPOKT

Behavioral Action Space

Application Delegate to Portal

An action where the application delegates to a portal to control their on-chain actions

Called By:

1. Application

Constraints:

Servicer Relay

A Servicer services the Application, by routing the Relay Request to the Service and forwarding the response to the Application.

Called By:

1. Servicer

Constraints:

Boundary Action Options:

1. Servicer Relay V1

Version 1 of selection policy for servicers to be using with relay.

Logic: The Servicer(s) that are paired to service an Application in a Session are equally distributed among all of the Servicers in the network. More logic can be found here: https://github.com/pokt-network/pocket-network-protocol/blob/main/utility/README.md#311-actor-selection-dispatch


Application Undelegation

If a staked Application wants to stop using a Portal, and prevent the Portal from further signing relays on its behalf, it would simply submit an on-chain UndelegateMsg. Further relays signed by the Portal on behalf of the Application would be rejected by the Servicers.

Called By:

1. Application

Constraints:

Submit Relay Request (Portal)

Portal submitting a relay request on behalf of an application.

Called By:

1. Portal

Constraints:

Portal Unregistration

A Portal is able to submit an UnstakeMsg to exit and remove itself from the network. After a successful UnstakeMsg, the Portal is no eligible sign relays on behalf of an Application. On-chain delegation from existing Applications will be removed from the world state. After the PortalUnstakingTime unbonding time elapses, the remaining stake is returned to the Portal's address.

Called By:

1. Portal

Constraints:

Portal Registration

Registration differs from staking in the sense that the pubKey is known but there are no economic benefits/penalties in this stage of the protocol's progression. The Portal must register on-chain in order for the Servicer to accept its signature as part of the ring. Future versions of the protocol may include on-chain rewards or penalties for the Portal, but the current iteration will incentivize Portals to provide a high quality, highly trusted service through free market economics.

Called By:

1. Portal

Constraints:

Control Action Space

Return Portal Stake

After unstaking, the original stake (i.e. deposit) is returned to the Portal's custodial account after an unbounding period has elapsed.

Constraints:

Policies

Application Delegate to Portal Policy

Policy for determining if application is able to delegate to a portal. The stake_per_app_delegation parameter, current stake of the portal, and current number of delegators will be used in determining if the portal is able to support the addition of this specific delegation.

Preceded By:

1. Application Delegate to Portal

Domain Spaces:

1. Application Delegate to Portal Space

Followed By:

1. Update Application Delegate

2. Add Portal Delegator

Codomain Spaces:

1. Application Delegate to Portal Space

2. Application Delegate to Portal Space

Constraints:

Servicer Relay Policy

The policy which determines what happens with a servicer relay including the fees. The servicer will be awarded their POKT and then either a portal or application will be charged this POKT (depending on the session). As well, it is possible that it is the end of the session in which case the session would be removed from the global state.

Preceded By:

1. Servicer Relay

Domain Spaces:

1. Servicer Relay Space

Followed By:

1. Modify Servicer POKT Holdings

2. Modify Portal POKT Holdings

3. Modify Application Stake

4. Increase Relay Fees

5. Remove Session

6. Burn Per Relay Policy

Codomain Spaces:

1. Modify Servicer POKT Space

2. Modify Portal POKT Space

3. Modify Application POKT Space

4. Increase Relay Fees Space

5. Servicer Relay Space

6. Servicer Relay Space

Constraints:

Preceded By:

1. Update Application Delegate

Portal Unregistration Policy

Policy which handles the logic of portal unregistration process. It will set the stake status and remove any references to the portal in terms of delegation.

Preceded By:

1. Portal Unregistration

Constraints:

Portal Registration Policy

Policy which handles the logic of portal registration and if enough stake is present. The portal is also added to the global state if it is approved.

Preceded By:

1. Portal Registration

1. Portal Registration Space

1. Modify Portal POKT Holdings

1. Modify Portal POKT Space

2. Modify Portal POKT Space

3. Portal Registration Space

Constraints:

Burn Per Relay Policy

The policy for determining the amount to be burned per relay. At current time there will be 0 burn but this may change in the future to move towards deflation.

Preceded By:

1. Servicer Relay Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Servicer Relay Space

Followed By:

1. Burn POKT Mechanism

2. Modify Application Stake

Codomain Spaces:

1. Burn POKT Mechanism Space

2. Modify Application POKT Space

Constraints:

The policy for determining the amount to be burned for session initiation.

1. Submit Relay Request Policy

Mechanisms

Update Application Delegate

The mechanism which updates delegate portal that can act on its behalf.

Preceded By:

1. Application Delegate to Portal Policy

2. Application Undelegate to Portal Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Application Delegate to Portal Space

State Updates:

1. Application.Delegate

Constraints:

Logic:

Set the delegate mechanism for the application at DOMAIN[0].application_public_key to DOMAIN[0].portal_public_key

Add Portal Delegator

The mechanism which adds an application that the portal is a delegator for.

Preceded By:

1. Application Delegate to Portal Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Application Delegate to Portal Space

State Updates:

1. Portal.Delegators

Constraints:

Logic:

Append the application at DOMAIN[0].application_public_key to the delegators attribute for the portal at DOMAIN[0].portal_public_key

The mechanism to update the personal holdings of a servicer

1. Servicer Stake Policy

2. Return Servicer Stake Policy

3. Servicer Relay Policy

4. Assign Servicer Salary Policy

State Updates:

1. Servicer.POKT Holdings

Constraints:

Logic:

The servicer at DOMAIN[0].servicer_address has its POKT Holdings modified by DOMAIN[0].value

The mechanism which tracks the relay fees

1. Servicer Relay Policy

State Updates:

1. Global.Relay Fees

Constraints:

Logic:

The relay fees increase by the POKT amount

Remove Session

The mechanism which removes a session from the global state.

Preceded By:

1. Servicer Relay Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Servicer Relay Space

State Updates:

1. Global.Sessions

Constraints:

Logic:

The session from DOMAIN[0] is removed from the global session state.

Remove Portal Delegator

The mechanism which removes an application that the portal is a delegator for.

Preceded By:

1. Application Undelegate to Portal Policy

2. Portal Unregistration Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Application Undelegation Space

State Updates:

1. Portal.Delegators

Constraints:

Logic:

Remove the application at DOMAIN[0].application_public_key from the delegators attribute for the portal at DOMAIN[0].portal_public_key

Create New Session

The mechanism which creates and adds a new session with which servicers will do relays on.

Preceded By:

1. Submit Relay Request Policy

2. Submit Relay Request (Portal) Policy

Domain Spaces:

1. Submit Relay Request Space

State Updates:

1. Global.Sessions

Constraints:

Logic:

Take DOMAIN[0] and create a new session, then append to the global state.

Burn POKT Mechanism

The mechanism which has the protocl burning POKT

1. Burn POKT Mechanism Space

State Updates:

1. Global.Floating Supply

Constraints:

Logic:

The floating supply decreases by the POKT amount
